19.title: Farmlands Portal Guide
19.description: Farmlands Co-operative (Farmands) have partnered with Centrapay Payment Gateway (Centrapay) to deliver a secure web portal for Farmlands Card payments.

20.title: Getting Started
20.description: The initial setup of your Business and all Branches (referred to as Merchants) will be managed by Farmlands. Farmlands will provide Centrapay with the details of a primary Account Owner for the business who will be loaded by Centrapay. Once setup this account owner will be able login and maintain the other members (users) who have or need access to the Account (see Members).

21.title: Business Information
21.description: The initial setup of your Business and all Branches (referred to as Merchants) will be managed by Farmlands. Farmlands will provide Centrapay with the details of a primary Account Owner for the business who will be loaded by Centrapay. Once setup this account owner will be able login and maintain the other members (users) who have or need access to the Account (see Members).

22.title: Registration
22.description: Once the Business and Merchants are set up in the Centrapay Portal, users will receive an email from Farmlands inviting them to register for the portal. Users must use the email address provided in the initial setup process to register.

23.title: Log In
23.description: The Centrapay Business Portal will store your authenticated session for up to 60 days. During this time, it is not necessary to re-authenticate simply enter your email address to log in. After 60 days, you will be prompted to re-authenticate by entering a Verification Code sent to your registered email address.

24.title: Dashboard
24.description: The Dashboard is an overview of Centrapay Business Account and will be your main screen for generating an authorisation or releasing a previous Farmlands Authorisation.

25.title: Farmlands Authorisations
25.description: The Centrapay Business Portal provides a real-time authorisation of a Farmlands Card when presented as payment for the purchase of goods or services. It validates that the Card is active and there is a sufficient available balance to process the transaction.

26.title: Authorisation Responses
26.description:
|          Type          |                                                                                                        Description                                                                                                         |
| ---------------------- | -------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- |
| Authorisation Approved | Funds have now been placed on hold onto the customer account, pending the receipt of the Card Partner’s invoice within the agreed period.                                                                                  |
| Pending                | Card Partner creates the request, but the authorisation is not yet complete. This authorisation is not approved.                                                                                                           |
| Check ID               | This response may occur for a high-value sale. This means the transaction is pending authorisation until the Card Partner confirms they have authenticated the customer’s photo ID against the name on the Farmlands Card. |
| Declined               | The authorisation is declined due to an invalid card number, a credit limit exceeded, or Card Partner is unable to verify a high-value transaction. Refer to Farmlands Contact Centre 0800 200 600                         |
| Release                | The funds “on hold” are cancelled by Card Partner. This may occur when a Card Partner is unable to fulfil an order. (This is not used for a refund).                                                                       |

27.title: Create a Farmlands Authorisation
27.description: Once an approved authorisation has been provided, a full GST invoice must be submitted to Farmlands at vendor.invoices@farmlands,co.nz. The Short Code shown on the Approval screen must be copied and clearly displayed in the PO field of the invoice or where previously confirmed with the Farmlands Team. The Farmlands 9-digit Card number can be provided in addition to the Short Code in another field. Settlement will be completed as per agreed payment terms.

28.title: Invoicing & Settlement
28.description: Once an approved authorisation has been provided, a full GST invoice must be submitted to Farmlands at vendor.invoices@farmlands,co.nz. The Short Code shown on the Approval screen must be copied and clearly displayed in the PO field of the invoice or where previously confirmed with the Farmlands Team. The Farmlands 9-digit Card number can be provided in addition to the Short Code in another field. Settlement will be completed as per agreed payment terms.

29.title: Releasing Funds
29.description: The Authorised funds will be held against the Cardholder account for 31 days or until the invoice is received.  If the order is cancelled before the invoice is submitted to Farmlands the Authorisation should be released to remove the hold on Cardholder funds.

30.title: Release Hold on Customer Funds
30.description: The Payments page provides a list of transactions that were previously authorised. You can search by using the Authorisation Short Code as the reference. Further search functionality will be available at a later date.

31.title: Authorisation History
31.description: The Payments page provides a list of transactions that were previously authorised. You can search by using the Authorisation Short Code as the reference. Further search functionality will be available at a later date.

32.title: Setting a Default Merchant
32.description: Select your Default Merchant (First-time user) - The default merchant is the branch or outlet that the user normally works from, and which the transaction will be associated with.

33.title: Manage My Centrapay Business Account
33.description: The Account Owner has access to additional options to manage their Centrapay Business Account, including adding an removing users who have access to complete authorisations on their account.

34.title: Merchants
34.description: This area relates to the management of new and existing Branches/Locations used for Centrapay’s other payment types e.g gift cards (i.e not Farmlands). Additional merchants added through the Merchants area will not be able to accept Farmlands Card until they are setup by Farmlands.

35.title: Bank Accounts
35.description: This function is only available to businesses who wish to use other Centrapay supported payment methods other than Farmlands Cards. (e.g. Gift Cards or NZD).

36.title: Members
36.description: On the Members page you can manage the members connected to the Centrapay Business Account. An Account Owner can see the list of members and pending invitations and easily add or remove members.

37.title: Settings
37.description: On the Settings page, you can change your business information. Please note this does not flow through to Farmlands. If you have a change of ownership, please contact Farmlands.

38.title: FAQs
38.description: The Support button opens up a form that will allow you to send a support request directly to Centrapay if you have any issues regarding the Centrapay Business Portal.

39.title: Support
39.description: The Support button opens up a form that will allow you to send a support request directly to Centrapay if you have any issues regarding the Centrapay Business Portal.

40.title: Farmlands POS Integration Guide
40.description: Farmlands has partnered with Centrapay to deliver new ways for your business to authorise and process Farmlands Card payments that are faster, easier, and more secure than ever.

41.title: Centrapay Integration Benefits
41.description: Integrating with Centrapay streamlines the process for authorising and invoicing Farmlands Card Payments. The integration provides:

42.title: Payment Flow Overview
42.description: Farmlands integrations use Centrapay’s Quick Pay Barcode Flow For Merchants to connect to Cardholders and accept Farmlands transactions.

43.title: Payment Flow Implementation
43.description: The Payment Flow can only be used by existing Farmlands Card Partners. Card Partners must complete the following steps to accept Farmlands transactions.

44.title: Merchant Configuration
44.description: Each Card Partner site that needs to accept Farmlands Card payments must be set up as a separate Centrapay Merchant with its own Merchant Config. The Merchant Config contains a Farmlands Payment Option that allows the site to accept Farmlands Payments.

45.title: Authentication
45.description: Requests to Centrapay’s APIs are authenticated by providing an API key in the X-Api-Key header. API Keys provide enduring access to a single Centrapay account.

46.title: Basic Requirements
46.description: The Payment Flow needs the following requirements to be met.

47.title: Payment Conditions
47.description: This extension enables the POS to enforce requiring an ID check for high-risk transactions.

48.title: Pre Auth
48.description: Farmlands Card Partners must support this extension when there is not an invoice number available at the point of sale or the purchase cannot be fulfilled immediately. This might happen if your stock is not on hand or you have a separate fulfilment process.

49.title: Cardholder Not Present
49.description: Farmlands Card Partners must support this extension if they accept payments when the Cardholder is not physically present when a payment is authorised. For example, to accept phone-based orders or orders where the Farmlands barcode is already known.

50.title: Validating Farmlands Barcodes
50.description: Farmlands Card Partners may optionally decode a scanned Farmlands Barcode to confirm that it is valid and apply Farmlands discounts before creating a Payment Request.

51.title: Handling Payment Errors
51.description: The POS must follow Centrapay’s guidelines on handling errors when dealing with inconsistencies in Payment Request statuses due to network issues or race conditions.

52.title: Refunds
52.description: Cardholder purchases are refunded by refunding the Payment Request.

53.title: Short Codes
53.description: Payment Requests have a short code field that is human- and OCR-friendly. When combined with the date or merchant id, short codes can unambiguously identify the correct Payment Request.

54.title: Testing Your Integration
54.description: Merchant Integrators need to work with Farmlands and Centrapay to get set up to test payments. Please contact Farmlands to organise full end-to-end testing.

55.title: Certification Requirements
55.description: For Centrapay to allow integrations to have production assets turned on, we require partners to complete a Certification Process.

64.title: Line Items

72.title: Quick Pay Flow
72.description: Quick Pay is used to immediately confirm the payment without requiring patron approval.

73.title: Checking Barcode Details
73.description: The POS can optionally decode a scanned barcode in order to get further details about a barcode before it creates a Payment Request. For example, the POS can use the barcode provider to apply any provider-specific discounts before creating the Payment Request.

74.title: Merchant Integration Error Handling
74.description: How to deal with inconsistencies in Payment Request statuses due to network issues or race conditions.

75.title: Respect Payment Status
75.description: Use the Payment Request status as the source of truth when determining if a Payment Request is paid or expired. For example, if cancelling a Payment Request fails with a REQUEST_PAID error then the terminal should respond accordingly; either by showing the transaction as paid or initiating a void instead.

76.title: Void Unknown Status
76.description: If the status of a transaction cannot be determined to be successful after retrying, then the Payment Request should be voided. Voiding a Payment Request will cancel the request and trigger any refunds if necessary.

77.title: Configure POS Timeout
77.description: Payment Requests have a configurable timeout which defaults to 2 minutes. Integrators should make sure that the payment terminal times out 5-10 seconds after the Payment Request.

78.title: Retry Unknown Errors
78.description: When faced with an unknown error while checking the status of a Payment Request, POS integrations should retry at least once before voiding the transaction.

79.title: Resolving Persistent Errors
79.description: For issues that cannot be resolved, please reach out to Centrapay Support at integrations@centrapay.com.

80.title: QR Code Flow for Merchants
80.description: How merchants can accept payments by presenting a QR code to the patron.

81.title: Patron Not Present
81.description: Centrapay’s Patron Not Present extension allows a merchant to complete a payment when the patron is not physically present at the time of payment.

82.title: Payment Conditions
82.description: Payment Conditions enable integrations to require conditional approval to accept specific Asset Types as payment.

83.title: Implementation
83.description: In order to support Payment Conditions, the merchant integration must extend Centrapay's payment protocol by creating the Payment Request with the conditionsEnabled flag set to true.

84.title: Additional Behaviors
84.description: The payment request status must always be polled after accepting or declining a condition as these actions may trigger the additional behaviors below.

85.title: Payment Flows
85.description: Centrapay facilitates secure and convenient transactions between customer and merchant devices, with multiple payment flows available for selection. Transact with ease and confidence using Centrapay.

86.title: Merchant-presented
86.description: When a merchant terminal has a customer-facing display it can prompt the customer to pay by showing a QR code.

87.title: Dynamic Merchant QR Code
87.description: When a merchant terminal is neither capable of displaying nor scanning QR codes or barcodes, such as for unattended vending machines, then a static QR code can be used.

88.title: Static Merchant QR Code
88.description: When a merchant terminal is neither capable of displaying nor scanning QR codes or barcodes, such as for unattended vending machines, then a static QR code can be used.

89.title: Patron-presented
89.description: When a merchant terminal is not capable of displaying a customer-facing QR code, then the payment request can be negotiated with the customer by scanning a barcode or QR code displayed on the customer’s smart device.

90.title: Dynamic Patron Barcode
90.description: This is a variant on Dynamic Patron Code. If you’ve setup a long lived Centrapay Enabled Barcode then you can use these to pay on behalf of a Customer. You may need to check a Customer’s Photo ID before this goes through.

91.title: Static Patron Barcode
91.description: This is a variant on Dynamic Patron Code. If you’ve setup a long lived Centrapay Enabled Barcode then you can use these to pay on behalf of a Customer. You may need to check a Customer’s Photo ID before this goes through.

92.title: Quick Pay
92.description: Quick Pay is used to pay the payment request after it is polled for the first time, without requiring patron approval. Quick Pay can only be triggered using the patron-presented flows, and the patron barcode must be linked to an asset type that allows quick pay.

107.description: How to request payment on the Centrapay payment platform.

108.title: Connecting With Patrons
108.description: The Payment Request object is a core part of Centrapay’s payment protocol. It represents the intention of a merchant to receive payment, defines the amount to be paid, and the acceptable Asset Types for payment.

109.title: Required Fields
109.description: We require compliant integrations to provide the following optional fields when creating a Payment Request.

110.title: Short Codes
110.description: Payment Requests have a short code that is human- and OCR-friendly. Short codes are recycled every two years. When combined with the date or merchant id, short codes can unambiguously identify the correct Payment Request.

111.title: Polling for Payment Confirmation
111.description: After connecting with the patron, the POS must poll the Payment Request status every second until the status has changed.

112.title: Protocol Extensions
112.description: Our payment protocol supports several optional extensions. Please review the extensions below and determine which ones you need for your integration.

113.title: Handling Payment Errors
113.description: Merchant integrations should follow our guidelines in Merchant Integration Error Handling when inconsistencies such as network issues or race conditions occur.

114.title: Requesting Pre Auth
114.description: Centrapay’s Pre Auth extension allows a patron to authorize payment up to a limit when the actual payment amount is not yet known.

115.title: Restrictions
115.description: Pre Auth payments are not supported in all cases.

116.title: Pre Auth Flow
116.description: Pre Auth payments go through an orthogonal payment flow compared to Centrapay’s standard payment flow.

117.title: Authorize
117.description: An authorization is created when the Payment Request is created with the preAuth flag while Requesting Payment.

118.title: Confirm
118.description: Merchants can draw down on authorized funds by making one or more confirmations against an authorized amount. Confirmations must be made with an idempotencyKey in order to prevent merchants from drawing down on authorized funds twice.

119.title: Release
119.description: Authorized funds that have not been confirmed can optionally be released so that the asset holder is granted access to their remaining funds without needing to wait for the authorization to expire.

120.title: Expiry
120.description: Authorizations automatically expire after 3 months. Any unreleased funds are subsequently released to the Patron.

121.title: Refund
121.description: Refunds can be made against authorizations, confirmations, released authorizations and expired authorizations.

122.title: Void
122.description: Voiding a Payment Request will cancel a Payment Request and trigger any refunds necessary. This operation is useful if the POS needs to back out of a transaction due to a network error for example. Voiding can only be used up to 24 hours after the Payment Request was created.

123.title: Transaction Reporting
123.description: Guidelines on communicating the Asset Types used for payment to the user in any transaction reporting function on the merchant side.
